intro: Dimorphanthera vestita, commonly known as the naked dimorphanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves that are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape. It produces strikingly large, showy flowers that are usually pink or red in color. Dimorphanthera vestita is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
